security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. Scanner misinterpreted documentation formatting (code blocks, project structures) as shell commands. This is legitimate MCP server documentation with no executable code. URLs referenced are official MCP documentation sites.

medium_findings.title: External Command Documentation
medium_findings.description: Documentation includes example shell commands for MCP Inspector testing (npx @anthropic/mcp-inspector). These are legitimate development commands shown in code blocks, not executable code.

low_findings.title: Documentation Code Blocks Misidentified as Shell Commands
low_findings.description: Static scanner flagged Korean text and project structure examples as 'shell backtick execution'. These are documentation formatting and directory tree structures, not shell commands.

low_findings.title: Documentation URLs Flagged as Hardcoded
low_findings.description: Scanner flagged URLs in documentation as 'hardcoded URLs'. These are legitimate reference links to official MCP documentation (modelcontextprotocol.io, github.com).

content.user_title: Build MCP Servers for Claude Integration
content.value_statement: Building custom MCP servers requires understanding protocol architecture, transport options, and tool definition patterns. This skill provides structured guidance for creating production-ready MCP servers that connect Claude to external services and APIs.
actual_capabilities: Guide MCP server project structure and architecture
Define transport options (stdio, Streamable HTTP, SSE)
Create tool schemas with input validation
Implement request handlers for tool execution
Test MCP servers with MCP Inspector
Build evaluation frameworks for server validation
limitations: This skill provides guidance, not executable code generation
Does not install or configure MCP SDK dependencies
Does not deploy servers to remote hosts
Does not handle authentication implementation details

use_cases.title: Create Custom MCP Server
use_cases.description: Build a new MCP server to connect Claude with a proprietary API or internal service, following the four-phase development process from research to evaluation.

use_cases.title: Add Tools to Existing Server
use_cases.description: Extend an existing MCP server with new tools, defining proper input schemas and error handling patterns for production use.

use_cases.title: Debug MCP Integration Issues
use_cases.description: Diagnose and fix issues in MCP server implementations by reviewing transport configuration, tool definitions, and request handling logic.

prompt_templates.title: New MCP Server Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new MCP server project for [SERVICE_NAME]. I need to connect to [API_ENDPOINT] and expose these operations: [LIST_OPERATIONS]. Use TypeScript with the official MCP SDK.
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new MCP server implementation

prompt_templates.title: Tool Definition
prompt_templates.prompt: Define a tool called [TOOL_NAME] for my MCP server. It should [DESCRIPTION]. The input parameters are: [PARAM_SPEC]. Show me the inputSchema and request handler code.
prompt_templates.scenario: Adding a specific tool to an existing server

prompt_templates.title: Transport Selection
prompt_templates.prompt: My MCP server will run in [ENVIRONMENT: local CLI / remote server / browser]. Recommend the appropriate transport mechanism and show how to configure it.

prompt_templates.title: Error Handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Improve error handling for my MCP server. Currently it [DESCRIBE_CURRENT_BEHAVIOR]. I need better error messages that include [WHAT_INFO]. Show me the pattern for actionable error responses.

output_examples.input: Create an MCP server that connects to a weather API
output_examples.output: A weather API MCP server structure with get_forecast tool accepting location and date parameters. The response shows proper inputSchema definition, error handling for API failures, and StdioServerTransport configuration for local CLI use.

output_examples.input: Add a search_files tool to my existing MCP server
output_examples.output: Code example showing ListToolsRequestSchema update with search_files tool definition, CallToolRequestSchema handler with glob pattern matching, and proper error responses for invalid search paths.

best_practices: Use descriptive tool names with underscores (get_user_profile, not getUser or doThing)
Design stateless tool implementations where possible for easier testing and scaling
Provide actionable error messages that guide users toward resolution
anti_patterns: Avoid generic tool names like 'doThing' or 'process' that lack clarity
Do not expose internal implementation details in tool descriptions
Avoid coupling server state to client sessions; keep tools stateless

faq.question: What is MCP?
faq.answer: MCP (Model Context Protocol) is a standard protocol for connecting Claude to external tools, data sources, and services through a well-defined server interface.

faq.question: Which programming language should I use?
faq.answer: TypeScript with the official MCP SDK is recommended for most use cases. Python developers can use FastMCP. Both provide similar capabilities.

faq.question: How do I test my MCP server?
faq.answer: Use MCP Inspector (npx @anthropic/mcp-inspector) to test tool calls and validate server behavior before integration with Claude.

faq.question: What transport should I choose?
faq.answer: Use stdio for local CLI servers. Choose Streamable HTTP for remote servers. Use SSE for browser-based implementations.

faq.question: How do I define tool input schemas?
faq.answer: Define inputSchema with type object, properties for each parameter, required array for mandatory fields, and descriptive error messages.

faq.question: Can this skill generate the complete server code?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance and code patterns. It does not generate complete executable code or install dependencies.
